definition[0]: the act of suddenly taking control of something, especially by force
example[0]: the fascist seizure of power in 1922
definition[1]: when the police or government officers take away illegal goods such as drugs or guns
definition[2]: a sudden condition in which someone cannot control the movements of their body, which continues for a short time
definition[3]: the act of taking goods or property because they are illegal, or because the owner has not paid a debt
example[3]: An authority may threaten seizure of goods or disconnection of vital supplies.
definition[4]: the act of forcing a company to stop trading because of debts or illegal activities
example[4]: The companyâ€™s failure, seizure and liquidation cost the state $2.6 billion.
